contextId.information: The word "name" is a metonym that stands for Jesus' identity and everything about him. AT: "Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The word "time" is a metonym that represents the right occasion for Jesus to show that he is the Messiah by working miracles. AT: "It is not yet the right time for me to perform a mighty act" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: My time has not yet come

contextId.information: Here "name" is a metonym that represents the person of Jesus. AT: "believed in him" or "trusted in him" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "world" is a metonym that refers to everyone in the world. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "heaven" is used as a metonym to refer to God. This can be stated in an active form. AT: "God has given it to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it has been given to him from heaven

contextId.information: John means that Jesus is greater than he is since Jesus is from heaven, and John was born on the earth. AT: "He who is born in this world is like everyone else who lives in the world and he speaks about what happens in this world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: He who is from the earth is from the earth and speaks about the earth

contextId.information: The "world" is a metonym that refers to all the people who live in the world. AT: "all the people of the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "word" is a metonym that represents the message of Jesus. AT: "anyone who hears my message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "name" is a metonym that symbolizes God's power and authority. AT: "I have come with my Father's authority" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "name" is a metonym that represents authority. AT: "If another should come in his own authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: If another should come in his own name

contextId.information: "Moses" is a metonym here that stands for the law itself. AT: "Moses accuses you in the Law, the very Law in which you have put your hopes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The one who accuses you is Moses ... your hopes

contextId.information: Here the "world" is a metonym for all of the people in the world who trust in Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Words" is a metonym that could possibly mean: 1) Jesus' words in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:06:32|6:32-58]] or 2) everything Jesus teaches. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The word "time" is a metonym. Jesus is implying that it is not the right time for him to bring his ministry to a close. AT: "It is not the right time for me to end my work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: My time has not yet come

contextId.information: Here the "world" is a metonym for the people who live in the world. AT: "All the people in the world cannot hate you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This "word" is a metonym which stands for the meaning of the message that Jesus had shared, which the Jewish leaders had failed to understand. AT: "What is he talking about when he said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: What is this word that he said

contextId.information: The word "hour" is a metonym for the time for Jesus to die. AT: "it was not yet the right time for Jesus to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: his hour had not yet come

contextId.information: Here the "world" is a metonym for the people who live in the world. AT: "these things I say to all the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: these things I say to the world

contextId.information: This is a metonym for what Jesus would accomplish during his life. AT: "what I would do during my life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The "world" is a metonym for "the people who live in the world." AT: "came to live among the people of this world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "name" is a metonym for the power of God.  Here "Father" is an important title for God. Jesus performed miracles through his Father's power and authority. AT: "through my Father's power" or "with my Father's power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])
contextId.quote: in the name of my Father

contextId.information: The word "hand" is a metonym that refers to God's possession and protective care. AT: "No one can steal them from my Father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "name" is a metonym, which means authority and power. AT: "comes as the representative of the Lord" or "comes in the power of the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: comes in the name of the Lord

contextId.information: "Daughter of Zion" is a metonym that refers to the people of Jerusalem. AT: "you people of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "this hour" is a metonym that represents when Jesus would suffer and die on the cross. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This represents God speaking. Sometimes people avoid referring directly to God because they respect him. AT: "God spoke from the heavens" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Here "his hands" is a metonym for power and authority. AT: "had given him complete power and authority over everything" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: had given everything over into his hands

contextId.information: Here "name" is a metonym that represents the authority of Jesus. AT: "Whatever you ask, using my authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Whatever you ask in my name

contextId.information: Here "name" is a metonym that represents the authority of Jesus. AT: "If you ask me anything as one of my followers, I will do it" or "Whatever you ask of me, I will do it because you belong to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: If you ask me anything in my name, I will do it

contextId.information: Here the "world" is a metonym that refers to the people who oppose God. AT: "The unbelieving people in this world will never welcome him" (UDB) or "Those who oppose God will not accept him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "world" is a metonym that represents the people who oppose God. AT: "not to those who do not belong to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the "word" is a metonym for the message that Jesus brings from God. AT: "The message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "name" is a metonym that represents Jesus' power and authority. AT: "because of me" or "for my sake" (See: [[[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "name" is a metonym that represents the authority of Jesus. AT: "Because you belong to me, whatever you ask of the Father, he will give it to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: whatever you ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you

contextId.information: Jesus uses the term "world" in these verses as a metonym to refer to the people who do not belong to God and are opposed to him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: If the world hates you ... therefore the world hates you

contextId.information: Here the "beginning" is a metonym that means the first days of Jesus' ministry. AT: "from the very first days when I began teaching the people and doing miracles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hour" is a metonym that refers to the time when people will persecute Jesus' followers. AT: "when they cause you to suffer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is a metonym that refers to the people in the world.(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the "world" is a metonym for the people who oppose God. AT: "but the people who oppose God will be glad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: but the world will be glad

contextId.information: Here the word "name" is a metonym that refers to the person and authority of Jesus. AT: "if you ask anything of the Father, he will give it to you because you belong to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: if you ask anything of the Father in my name, he will give it to you

contextId.information: Here "name" is a metonym that refers to the person and authority of Jesus. The Father will honor the requests of the believers because of their relationship with Jesus. AT: "because you are my followers" or "on my authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "name" is a metonym for the person and authority of Jesus. AT: "you will ask because you belong to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you will ask in my name

contextId.information: Here "the world" refers to the troubles and persecution that believers will endure from those who oppose God. AT: "I have conquered the troubles of this world" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "name" is a metonym that refers to the person of God. AT: "I taught them who you really are and what you are like." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "world" is a metonym that refers to the people of the world that oppose God. This means that God has separated the believers spiritually from the people who do not believe in him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "world" is a metonym that refers to the people who oppose God. AT: "I am not praying for those who do not belong to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I do not pray for the world

contextId.information: Here the word "name" is a metonym that refers to God's protection and oversight. AT: "keep them under the protection of your name just as you have protected me" or "protect them by the power of your name that you have given me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: keep them in your name that you have given me

contextId.information: Here "name" is a metonym that refers to the power and protection of God. AT: "I kept them with your protection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I kept them in your name

contextId.information: Here "world" is a metonym for the people who live in the world. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "the "world" is a metonym that refers to the people who oppose God. AT: "The people who oppose you have hated my followers because they do not belong to those who do not believe, just as I do not belong to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the world ... because they are not of the world ... I am not of the world

contextId.information: In this passage, "the world" is a metonym for the people who oppose God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here into "the world" is a metonym that means to the people who live in the world. AT: "to the people of the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "the world" is a metonym that refers to the people who do not know God. AT: "that all the people will know" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The "world" is a metonym for the people who do not belong to God. AT: "those who do not belong to you do not know what you are like" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the world did not know you

contextId.information: Here "world" is a metonym for the people who oppose Jesus. Possible meanings are 1) "My kingdom is not part of this world" (UDB) or 2) "I do not need this world's permission to rule as their king" or "It is not from this world that I have authority to be king." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: My kingdom is not of this world
